fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of size. When this is set to zero, batched data will be sent immediately.

fields.name: SendBatchSize
fields.description: SendBatchSize is the size of a batch which after hit, will trigger it to be sent. When this is set to zero, the batch size is ignored and data will be sent immediately subject to only send_batch_max_size.

fields.name: SendBatchMaxSize
fields.description: SendBatchMaxSize is the maximum size of a batch. It must be larger than SendBatchSize. Larger batches are split into smaller units. Default value is 0, that means no maximum size.

fields.name: MetadataKeys
fields.description: MetadataKeys is a list of client.Metadata keys that will be used to form distinct batchers.  If this setting is empty, a single batcher instance will be used.  When this setting is not empty, one batcher will be used per distinct combination of values for the listed metadata keys. Empty value and unset metadata are treated as distinct cases. Entries are case-insensitive.  Duplicated entries will trigger a validation error.

fields.name: MetadataCardinalityLimit
fields.description: MetadataCardinalityLimit indicates the maximum number of batcher instances that will be created through a distinct combination of MetadataKeys.

fields.name: Verbosity
fields.description: Verbosity defines the debug exporter verbosity.

fields.name: SamplingInitial
fields.description: SamplingInitial defines how many samples are initially logged during each second.

fields.name: SamplingThereafter
fields.description: SamplingThereafter defines the sampling rate after the initial samples are logged.

fields.name: UseInternalLogger
fields.description: UseInternalLogger defines whether the exporter sends the output to the collector's internal logger.

fields.name: CheckInterval
fields.description: CheckInterval is the time between measurements of memory usage for the purposes of avoiding going over the limits. Defaults to zero, so no checks will be performed.

fields.name: MinGCIntervalWhenSoftLimited
fields.description: MinGCIntervalWhenSoftLimited minimum interval between forced GC when in soft (=limit_mib - spike_limit_mib) limited mode. Zero value means no minimum interval. GCs is a CPU-heavy operation and executing it too frequently may affect the recovery capabilities of the collector.

fields.name: MinGCIntervalWhenHardLimited
fields.description: MinGCIntervalWhenHardLimited minimum interval between forced GC when in hard (=limit_mib) limited mode. Zero value means no minimum interval. GCs is a CPU-heavy operation and executing it too frequently may affect the recovery capabilities of the collector.

fields.name: MemoryLimitMiB
fields.description: MemoryLimitMiB is the maximum amount of memory, in MiB, targeted to be allocated by the process.

fields.name: MemorySpikeLimitMiB
fields.description: MemorySpikeLimitMiB is the maximum, in MiB, spike expected between the measurements of memory usage.

fields.name: MemoryLimitPercentage
fields.description: MemoryLimitPercentage is the maximum amount of memory, in %, targeted to be allocated by the process. The fixed memory settings MemoryLimitMiB has a higher precedence.

fields.name: MemorySpikePercentage
fields.description: MemorySpikePercentage is the maximum, in percents against the total memory, spike expected between the measurements of memory usage.

fields.name: CheckInterval
fields.description: CheckInterval is the time between measurements of memory usage for the purposes of avoiding going over the limits. Defaults to zero, so no checks will be performed.

fields.name: MinGCIntervalWhenSoftLimited
fields.description: MinGCIntervalWhenSoftLimited minimum interval between forced GC when in soft (=limit_mib - spike_limit_mib) limited mode. Zero value means no minimum interval. GCs is a CPU-heavy operation and executing it too frequently may affect the recovery capabilities of the collector.

fields.name: MinGCIntervalWhenHardLimited
fields.description: MinGCIntervalWhenHardLimited minimum interval between forced GC when in hard (=limit_mib) limited mode. Zero value means no minimum interval. GCs is a CPU-heavy operation and executing it too frequently may affect the recovery capabilities of the collector.

fields.name: MemoryLimitMiB
fields.description: MemoryLimitMiB is the maximum amount of memory, in MiB, targeted to be allocated by the process.

fields.name: MemorySpikeLimitMiB
fields.description: MemorySpikeLimitMiB is the maximum, in MiB, spike expected between the measurements of memory usage.

fields.name: MemoryLimitPercentage
fields.description: MemoryLimitPercentage is the maximum amount of memory, in %, targeted to be allocated by the process. The fixed memory settings MemoryLimitMiB has a higher precedence.

fields.name: MemorySpikePercentage
fields.description: MemorySpikePercentage is the maximum, in percents against the total memory, spike expected between the measurements of memory usage.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to enable expvar service. (default = false)

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: TracesURLPath
fields.description: The URL path to receive traces on. If omitted "/v1/traces" will be used.

fields.name: MetricsURLPath
fields.description: The URL path to receive metrics on. If omitted "/v1/metrics" will be used.

fields.name: LogsURLPath
fields.description: The URL path to receive logs on. If omitted "/v1/logs" will be used.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: TracesEndpoint
fields.description: The URL to send traces to. If omitted the Endpoint + "/v1/traces" will be used.

fields.name: MetricsEndpoint
fields.description: The URL to send metrics to. If omitted the Endpoint + "/v1/metrics" will be used.

fields.name: LogsEndpoint
fields.description: The URL to send logs to. If omitted the Endpoint + "/v1/logs" will be used.

fields.name: ProfilesEndpoint
fields.description: The URL to send profiles to. If omitted the Endpoint + "/v1development/profiles" will be used.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: The encoding to export telemetry (default: "proto")

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC client. See grpc.WithReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC gRPC. See grpc.WithWriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithWriteBufferSize).

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC client.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding identifies the encoding of records received from Firehose. Defaults to telemetry-specific encodings: "cwlog" for logs, and "cwmetrics" for metrics.

fields.name: RecordType
fields.description: RecordType is an alias for Encoding for backwards compatibility. It is an error to specify both encoding and record_type. Deprecated: [v0.121.0] use Encoding instead.

fields.name: AccessKey
fields.description: AccessKey is checked against the one received with each request. This can be set when creating or updating the Firehose delivery stream.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval is the interval at which metrics should be collected

fields.name: QueueURL
fields.description: QueueURL is the URL of the SQS queue to receive S3 notifications.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region specifies the AWS region of the SQS queue.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint is the optional custom endpoint for SQS (useful for testing).

fields.name: WaitTimeSeconds
fields.description: WaitTimeSeconds specifies the duration (in seconds) for long polling SQS messages. Maximum is 20 seconds. Default is 20 seconds.

fields.name: MaxNumberOfMessages
fields.description: MaxNumberOfMessages specifies the maximum number of messages to receive in a single poll. Valid values: 1-10. Default is 10.

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: Type of authentication to use

fields.name: ConnectionString
fields.description: Azure Blob Storage connection key, which can be found in the Azure Blob Storage resource on the Azure Portal. (no default)

fields.name: StorageAccountURL
fields.description: Storage Account URL, used with Service Principal authentication

fields.name: TenantID
fields.description: Tenant ID, used with Service Principal authentication

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: Client ID, used with Service Principal authentication

fields.name: ClientSecret
fields.description: Client secret, used with Service Principal authentication

fields.name: Cloud
fields.description: Azure Cloud to authenticate against, used with Service Principal authentication

fields.name: EndPoint
fields.description: Azure Event Hub endpoint triggering on the `Blob Create` event

fields.name: ContainerName
fields.description: Name of the blob container with the logs (default = "logs")

fields.name: ContainerName
fields.description: Name of the blob container with the traces (default = "traces")

fields.name: PollRate
fields.description: azeventhub lib specific

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval is the interval at which metrics should be collected. The default is 60 second.

fields.name: ContainerOrchestrator
fields.description: ContainerOrchestrator is the type of container orchestration service, e.g. eks or ecs. The default is eks.

fields.name: TagService
fields.description: Whether to add the associated service name as attribute. The default is true

fields.name: PrefFullPodName
fields.description: The "PodName" attribute is set based on the name of the relevant controllers like Daemonset, Job, ReplicaSet, ReplicationController, ... If it cannot be set that way and PrefFullPodName is true, the "PodName" attribute is set to the pod's own name. The default value is false

fields.name: AddFullPodNameMetricLabel
fields.description: The "FullPodName" attribute is the pod name including suffix If false FullPodName label is not added The default value is false

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

filter_set_exclude:

      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:

    spark.stage.id:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:

fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: TCPIdleTimeout
fields.description: TCPIdleTimeout is the timeout for idle TCP connections, it is ignored if transport being used is UDP.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint is the published address or unix socket that allows clients to connect to: The allowed format is:   unix:///path/to/chronyd/unix.sock   udp://localhost:323 The default value is unix:///var/run/chrony/chronyd.sock

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    ntp.frequency.offset:
      enabled: true
    ntp.skew:
      enabled: true
    ntp.stratum:
      enabled: true
    ntp.time.correction:
      enabled: true
    ntp.time.last_offset:
      enabled: true
    ntp.time.rms_offset:
      enabled: true
    ntp.time.root_delay:
      enabled: true
none_set:
  metrics:
    ntp.frequency.offset:
      enabled: false
    ntp.skew:
      enabled: false
    ntp.stratum:
      enabled: false
    ntp.time.correction:
      enabled: false
    ntp.time.last_offset:
      enabled: false
    ntp.time.rms_offset:
      enabled: false
    ntp.time.root_delay:
      enabled: false

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    couchdb.average_request_time:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.database.open:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.database.operations:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.file_descriptor.open:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.httpd.bulk_requests:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.httpd.requests:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.httpd.responses:
      enabled: true
    couchdb.httpd.views:
      enabled: true
  resource_attributes:
    couchdb.node.name:
      enabled: true
none_set:
  metrics:
    couchdb.average_request_time:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.database.open:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.database.operations:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.file_descriptor.open:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.httpd.bulk_requests:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.httpd.requests:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.httpd.responses:
      enabled: false
    couchdb.httpd.views:
      enabled: false
  resource_attributes:
    couchdb.node.name:
      enabled: false
filter_set_include:
  resource_attributes:
    couchdb.node.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
filter_set_exclude:
  resource_attributes:
    couchdb.node.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "couchdb.node.name-val"

fields.name: ListenAddress
fields.description: The address to listen on for incoming Fluent Forward events.  Should be of the form `<ip addr>:<port>` (TCP) or `unix://<socket_path>` (Unix domain socket).

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Nodes
fields.description: Nodes defines the nodes to scrape. See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/cluster.html#cluster-nodes for which selectors may be used here. If Nodes is empty, no nodes will be scraped.

fields.name: SkipClusterMetrics
fields.description: SkipClusterMetrics indicates whether cluster level metrics from /_cluster/* endpoints should be scraped or not.

fields.name: Indices
fields.description: Indices defines the indices to scrape. See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-stats.html#index-stats-api-path-params for which names are viable. If Indices is empty, no indices will be scraped.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username is the username used when making REST calls to elasticsearch. Must be specified if Password is. Not required.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password is the password used when making REST calls to elasticsearch. Must be specified if Username is. Not required.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: path for data collection. default is /events

fields.name: HealthPath
fields.description: path for health check api. default is /health_check

fields.name: RequiredHeaders
fields.description: optional setting to set one or more required headers for all requests to have (except the health check)

fields.name: Customizable
fields.description: can be overwritten via required_headers

fields.name: Fixed
fields.description: are not allowed to be overwritten

fields.name: Secret
fields.description: secret for webhook

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: Only has effect if Endpoint is not ""

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Subscription
fields.description: The fully qualified resource name of the Pubsub subscription

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Lock down the encoding of the payload, leave empty for attribute based detection

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: Lock down the compression of the payload, leave empty for attribute based detection

fields.name: IgnoreEncodingError
fields.description: Ignore errors when the configured encoder fails to decoding a PubSub messages

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: The client id that will be used by Pubsub to make load balancing decisions

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: ContainerLabelsToMetricLabels
fields.description: A mapping of container label names to MetricDescriptor label keys. The corresponding container label value will become the DataPoint label value for the mapped name.  E.g. `io.kubernetes.container.name: container_spec_name` would result in a MetricDescriptor label called `container_spec_name` whose Metric DataPoints have the value of the `io.kubernetes.container.name` container label.

fields.name: EnvVarsToMetricLabels
fields.description: A mapping of container environment variable names to MetricDescriptor label keys.  The corresponding env var values become the DataPoint label value. E.g. `APP_VERSION: version` would result MetricDescriptors having a label key called `version` whose DataPoint label values are the value of the `APP_VERSION` environment variable configured for that particular container, if present.
