fields.name: JARPath
fields.description: The path for the JMX Metric Gatherer or JMX Scraper JAR (/opt/opentelemetry-java-contrib-jmx-metrics.jar by default). Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The Service URL or host:port for the target coerced to one of form: service:jmx:rmi:///jndi/rmi://<host>:<port>/jmxrmi. Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: TargetSystem
fields.description: Comma-separated list of systems to monitor Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: TargetSource
fields.description: The target source of metric definitions to use for the target system. Supported values are: auto, instrumentation and legacy. Supported by: jmx-scraper

fields.name: JmxConfigs
fields.description: Comma-separated list of paths to custom YAML metrics definition, mandatory when TargetSystem is not set. Supported by: jmx-scraper

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: The duration in between groovy script invocations and metric exports (10 seconds by default). Will be converted to milliseconds. Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The OTLP Receiver endpoint to send metrics to ("0.0.0.0:<random open port>" by default).

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers to include in OTLP metric submission requests.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: The JMX username Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: Password
fields.description: The JMX password Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: KeystorePath
fields.description: The keystore path for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: KeystorePassword
fields.description: The keystore password for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: KeystoreType
fields.description: The keystore type for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: TruststorePath
fields.description: The truststore path for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: TruststorePassword
fields.description: The truststore password for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: TruststoreType
fields.description: The truststore type for SSL Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: RemoteProfile
fields.description: The JMX remote profile.  Should be one of: `"SASL/PLAIN"`, `"SASL/DIGEST-MD5"`, `"SASL/CRAM-MD5"`, `"TLS SASL/PLAIN"`, `"TLS SASL/DIGEST-MD5"`, or `"TLS SASL/CRAM-MD5"`, though no enforcement is applied. Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: Realm
fields.description: The SASL/DIGEST-MD5 realm Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: AdditionalJars
fields.description: Array of additional JARs to be added to the class path when launching the JMX Metric Gatherer JAR Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: ResourceAttributes
fields.description: Map of resource attributes used by the Java SDK Autoconfigure to set resource attributes Supported by: jmx-scraper and jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: LogLevel
fields.description: Log level used by the JMX metric gatherer. Should be one of: `"trace"`, `"debug"`, `"info"`, `"warn"`, `"error"`, `"off"` Supported by: jmx-metric-gatherer

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target to which the exporter is going to send traces or metrics, using the gRPC protocol. The valid syntax is described at https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC client. See grpc.WithReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC gRPC. See grpc.WithWriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithWriteBufferSize).

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC client.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: RootPath
fields.description: RootPath is the host's root directory (linux only).

fields.name: MetadataCollectionInterval
fields.description: Collection interval for metadata. Metadata of the particular entity is collected when the entity changes. In addition metadata of all entities is collected periodically even if no changes happen. Setting the duration to 0 will disable periodic collection (however will not impact metadata collection on changes).

fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout

fields.name: HealthPath

fields.description: optional setting to set one or more required headers for all requests to have (except the health check)

fields.name: Customizable

fields.name: Fixed
fields.description: are not allowed to be overwritten

fields.name: Secret

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    vcs.change.count:
      enabled: true
    vcs.change.duration:
      enabled: true
    vcs.change.time_to_approval:
      enabled: true
    vcs.change.time_to_merge:
      enabled: true
    vcs.contributor.count:
      enabled: true
    vcs.ref.count:
      enabled: true
    vcs.ref.lines_delta:
      enabled: true
    vcs.ref.revisions_delta:
      enabled: true
    vcs.ref.time:
      enabled: true
    vcs.repository.count:
      enabled: true
  resource_attributes:
    vcs.owner.name:
      enabled: true
    vcs.provider.name:
      enabled: true
none_set:
  metrics:
    vcs.change.count:
      enabled: false
    vcs.change.duration:
      enabled: false
    vcs.change.time_to_approval:
      enabled: false
    vcs.change.time_to_merge:
      enabled: false
    vcs.contributor.count:
      enabled: false
    vcs.ref.count:
      enabled: false
    vcs.ref.lines_delta:
      enabled: false
    vcs.ref.revisions_delta:
      enabled: false
    vcs.ref.time:
      enabled: false
    vcs.repository.count:
      enabled: false
  resource_attributes:
    vcs.owner.name:
      enabled: false
    vcs.provider.name:
      enabled: false
filter_set_include:
  resource_attributes:
    vcs.owner.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
    vcs.provider.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
filter_set_exclude:
  resource_attributes:
    vcs.owner.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "vcs.owner.name-val"
    vcs.provider.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "vcs.provider.name-val"

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Nodes
fields.description: Nodes defines the nodes to scrape. See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.9/cluster.html#cluster-nodes for which selectors may be used here. If Nodes is empty, no nodes will be scraped.

fields.name: SkipClusterMetrics
fields.description: SkipClusterMetrics indicates whether cluster level metrics from /_cluster/* endpoints should be scraped or not.

fields.name: Indices
fields.description: Indices defines the indices to scrape. See https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-stats.html#index-stats-api-path-params for which names are viable. If Indices is empty, no indices will be scraped.

fields.name: NoVerifySSL
fields.description: Number of seconds before timing out a request.

fields.name: ProxyAddress
fields.description: Upload segments to AWS X-Ray through a proxy.

fields.name: ProjectID
fields.description: ProjectID is a string to reference project where metrics should be associated with. If ProjectID is not filled in, the SDK will automatically call the IAM service to query the project id corresponding to the region.

fields.name: RegionID
fields.description: RegionID is the ID of the CES region.

fields.name: Period
fields.description: How retrieved data from Cloud Eye is aggregated. Possible values are 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400. 1: Cloud Eye performs no aggregation and displays raw data. 300: Cloud Eye aggregates data every 5 minutes. 1200: Cloud Eye aggregates data every 20 minutes. 3600: Cloud Eye aggregates data every hour. 14400: Cloud Eye aggregates data every 4 hours. 86400: Cloud Eye aggregates data every 24 hours. For details about the aggregation, see https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/ces_faq/ces_faq_0009.html

fields.name: Filter
fields.description: Data aggregation method. The supported values are max, min, average, sum, variance.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout of the http server

fields.name: TraceIDCacheSize
fields.description: TraceIDCacheSize sets the cache size for the 64 bits to 128 bits mapping

fields.name: Behavior
fields.description: Behavior sets how the `/intake` endpoint should behave. The value should be one of: `disable` (default) - disable the endpoint entirely `proxy` - proxy the requests to Datadog itself

fields.name: Key
fields.description: Key is the Datadog API key to associate your Agent's data with your organization. Create a new API key here: https://app.datadoghq.com/account/settings

fields.name: Site
fields.description: Site is the site of the Datadog intake to send data to. The default value is "datadoghq.com".

fields.name: FailOnInvalidKey
fields.description: FailOnInvalidKey states whether to exit at startup on invalid API key. The default value is false.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Brokers
fields.description: Brokers holds the list of Kafka bootstrap servers (default localhost:9092).

fields.name: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly
fields.description: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly configures the Kafka client to perform a DNS lookup on each of the provided brokers, and then perform a reverse lookup on the resulting IPs to obtain the canonical hostnames to use as the bootstrap servers. This can be required in SASL environments.

fields.name: ProtocolVersion
fields.description: ProtocolVersion defines the Kafka protocol version that the client will assume it is running against.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: ClientID holds the client ID advertised to Kafka, which can be used for enforcing ACLs, throttling quotas, and more (default "otel-collector")

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username to be used on authentication

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password to be used on authentication

fields.name: Mechanism
fields.description: SASL Mechanism to be used, possible values are: (PLAIN, AWS_MSK_IAM_OAUTHBEARER, SCRAM-SHA-256 or SCRAM-SHA-512).

fields.name: Version
fields.description: SASL Protocol Version to be used, possible values are: (0, 1). Defaults to 0.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region is the AWS region the MSK cluster is based in

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: Full
fields.description: Whether to maintain a full set of metadata for all topics, or just the minimal set that has been necessary so far. The full set is simpler and usually more convenient, but can take up a substantial amount of memory if you have many topics and partitions. Defaults to true.

fields.name: RefreshInterval
fields.description: RefreshInterval controls the frequency at which cluster metadata is refreshed. Defaults to 10 minutes.

fields.name: Max
fields.description: The total number of times to retry a metadata request when the cluster is in the middle of a leader election or at startup (default 3).

fields.name: Backoff
fields.description: How long to wait for leader election to occur before retrying (default 250ms). Similar to the JVM's `retry.backoff.ms`.

fields.name: RackID
fields.description: RackID provides the rack identifier for this client to enable rack-aware replica selection when supported by the brokers. This maps to Kafka's standard "client.rack" setting. By default, this is empty.

fields.name: SessionTimeout
fields.description: SessionTimeout controls the Kafka consumer group session timeout. The session timeout is used to detect the consumer's liveness.

fields.name: HeartbeatInterval
fields.description: HeartbeatInterval controls the Kafka consumer group coordination heartbeat interval. Heartbeats ensure the consumer's session remains active.

fields.name: GroupID
fields.description: GroupID specifies the ID of the consumer group that will be consuming messages from (default "otel-collector").

fields.name: InitialOffset
fields.description: InitialOffset specifies the initial offset to use if no offset was previously committed. Must be `latest` or `earliest` (default "latest").

fields.name: Enable
fields.description: Whether or not to auto-commit updated offsets back to the broker. (default enabled).

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: How frequently to commit updated offsets. Ineffective unless auto-commit is enabled (default 1s)

fields.name: MinFetchSize
fields.description: The minimum bytes per fetch from Kafka (default "1")

fields.name: DefaultFetchSize
fields.description: The default bytes per fetch from Kafka (default "1048576")

fields.name: MaxFetchSize
fields.description: The maximum bytes per fetch from Kafka (default "0", no limit)

fields.name: MaxFetchWait
fields.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for MinFetchSize bytes to be available before the broker returns a response (default 250ms)

fields.name: GroupRebalanceStrategy
fields.description: RebalanceStrategy specifies the strategy to use for partition assignment. Possible values are "range", "roundrobin", and "sticky". Defaults to "range".

fields.name: GroupInstanceID
fields.description: GroupInstanceID specifies the ID of the consumer

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic from which messages of the signal type should be consumed. The default depends on the signal type:  - "otlp_spans" for traces  - "otlp_metrics" for metrics  - "otlp_logs" for logs  - "otlp_profiles" for profiles

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the expected encoding of messages for the signal type Defaults to "otlp_proto".

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic from which messages of the signal type should be consumed. The default depends on the signal type:  - "otlp_spans" for traces  - "otlp_metrics" for metrics  - "otlp_logs" for logs  - "otlp_profiles" for profiles

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the expected encoding of messages for the signal type Defaults to "otlp_proto".

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic from which messages of the signal type should be consumed. The default depends on the signal type:  - "otlp_spans" for traces  - "otlp_metrics" for metrics  - "otlp_logs" for logs  - "otlp_profiles" for profiles

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the expected encoding of messages for the signal type Defaults to "otlp_proto".

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic from which messages of the signal type should be consumed. The default depends on the signal type:  - "otlp_spans" for traces  - "otlp_metrics" for metrics  - "otlp_logs" for logs  - "otlp_profiles" for profiles

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the expected encoding of messages for the signal type Defaults to "otlp_proto".

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic from which to consume data. Topic has no default. If explicitly specified, it will take precedence over the default values of Logs.Topic, Traces.Topic, and Metrics.Topic. Deprecated [v0.124.0]: Use Logs.Topic, Traces.Topic, and Metrics.Topic.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the expected encoding of messages (default "otlp_proto") Encoding has no default. If explicitly specified, it will take precedence over the default values of Logs.Encoding, Traces.Encoding, and Metrics.Encoding. Deprecated [v0.124.0]: Use Logs.Encoding, Traces.Encoding, and Metrics.Encoding.

fields.name: After
fields.description: If true, the messages are marked after the pipeline execution

fields.name: OnError
fields.description: If false, only the successfully processed messages are marked. This only applies to non-permanent errors. It has no impact if After is set to false. Note: this can block the entire partition in case a message processing returns a non-permanent error.

fields.name: OnPermanentError
fields.description: If false, only the successfully processed messages are marked. This only applies to permanent errors. It has no impact if After is set to false. Default value inherits from OnError for backward compatibility. Note: this can block the entire partition in case a message processing returns a permanent error.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: Namespaces
fields.description: List of namespaces to collect events from.

fields.name: makeClient
fields.description: For mocking

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Mode represents the mode of the k8slog receiver. Valid values are: - "daemonset-stdout": (default) otel is deployed as a daemonset and collects logs from stdout of containers. Will be supported in the future: - "daemonset-file": otel is deployed as a daemonset and collects logs from files inside containers. - "sidecar": otel is deployed as a sidecar and collects logs from files.

fields.name: NodeFromEnv
fields.description: NodeFromEnv represents the environment variable which contains the node name.

fields.name: HostRoot
fields.description: HostRoot represents the path which is used to mount the host's root filesystem.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: RuntimeAPIs
fields.description: RuntimeAPIs represents the configuration for the runtime APIs.

fields.name: Metadata
fields.description: Metadata represents the list of metadata fields to extract from pod. TODO: supported metadata fields and default values.

fields.name: Annotations
fields.description: Annotations represents the rules to extract from pod annotations.

fields.name: Labels
fields.description: Labels represents the rules to extract from pod labels.

fields.name: Env
fields.description: Env represents the rules to extract from container environment variables.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

default:
all_set:

    memcached.bytes:

      enabled: true
    memcached.connections.total:
      enabled: true
    memcached.cpu.usage:

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge

fields.name: RequestParameters

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout

fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: TracesURLPaths
fields.description: The URL path to receive traces on. If omitted "/" will be used.

fields.name: Scheme
fields.description: The scheme defines the type of flow data that the listener will receive The scheme must be one of sflow, netflow, or flow

fields.name: Hostname
fields.description: The hostname or IP address that the listener will bind to

fields.name: Port
fields.description: The port that the listener will bind to

fields.name: Sockets
fields.description: The number of sockets that the listener will use

fields.name: Workers
fields.description: The number of workers that the listener will use to decode incoming flow messages By default it will be two times the number of sockets Ideally set this to the number of CPU cores

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: The size of the queue that the listener will use This is a buffer that will hold flow messages before they are processed by a worker

fields.name: SendRaw
fields.description: SendRaw determines whether to send raw flow messages instead of parsing them

fields.name: CollectionInterval

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Brokers
fields.description: Brokers holds the list of Kafka bootstrap servers (default localhost:9092).

fields.name: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly
fields.description: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly configures the Kafka client to perform a DNS lookup on each of the provided brokers, and then perform a reverse lookup on the resulting IPs to obtain the canonical hostnames to use as the bootstrap servers. This can be required in SASL environments.

fields.name: ProtocolVersion
fields.description: ProtocolVersion defines the Kafka protocol version that the client will assume it is running against.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: ClientID holds the client ID advertised to Kafka, which can be used for enforcing ACLs, throttling quotas, and more (default "otel-collector")

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username to be used on authentication

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password to be used on authentication

fields.name: Mechanism

fields.name: Version
fields.description: SASL Protocol Version to be used, possible values are: (0, 1). Defaults to 0.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region is the AWS region the MSK cluster is based in

fields.name: Full
fields.description: Whether to maintain a full set of metadata for all topics, or just the minimal set that has been necessary so far. The full set is simpler and usually more convenient, but can take up a substantial amount of memory if you have many topics and partitions. Defaults to true.

fields.name: RefreshInterval
fields.description: RefreshInterval controls the frequency at which cluster metadata is refreshed. Defaults to 10 minutes.

fields.name: Max
fields.description: The total number of times to retry a metadata request when the cluster is in the middle of a leader election or at startup (default 3).

fields.name: Backoff
fields.description: How long to wait for leader election to occur before retrying (default 250ms). Similar to the JVM's `retry.backoff.ms`.

fields.name: RackID
fields.description: RackID provides the rack identifier for this client to enable rack-aware replica selection when supported by the brokers. This maps to Kafka's standard "client.rack" setting. By default, this is empty.

fields.name: ClusterAlias
fields.description: Alias name of the kafka cluster

fields.name: TopicMatch
fields.description: TopicMatch topics to collect metrics on

fields.name: GroupMatch
fields.description: GroupMatch consumer groups to collect on

fields.name: RefreshFrequency
fields.description: Cluster metadata refresh frequency Configures the refresh frequency to update cached cluster metadata Defaults to 10 minutes from Sarama library If Metadata.RefreshInterval is set, this will be ignored. Deprecated [v0.122.0]: use Metadata.RefreshInterval instead.

fields.name: Scrapers
fields.description: Scrapers defines which metric data points to be captured from kafka

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: Projects
fields.description: these parameters are only relevant in retrieval mode

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.
