fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify controls whether the client verifies the server's certificate chain and host name.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. The address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: ExtraMetadataLabels
fields.description: ExtraMetadataLabels contains list of extra metadata that should be taken from /pods endpoint and put as extra labels on metrics resource. No additional metadata is fetched by default, so there are no extra calls to /pods endpoint. Supported values include container.id and k8s.volume.type.

fields.name: MetricGroupsToCollect
fields.description: MetricGroupsToCollect provides a list of metrics groups to collect metrics from. "container", "pod", "node" and "volume" are the only valid groups.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: NodeName
fields.description: NodeName is the node name to limit the discovery of nodes. For example, node name can be set using the downward API inside the collector pod spec as follows: env:   - name: K8S_NODE_NAME     valueFrom:       fieldRef:         fieldPath: spec.nodeName Then set this value to ${env:K8S_NODE_NAME} in the configuration.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "k8s.volume.name-val"
    k8s.volume.type:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "k8s.volume.type-val"
    partition:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "partition-val"

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    nginx.connections_accepted:
      enabled: true
    nginx.connections_current:
      enabled: true
    nginx.connections_handled:
      enabled: true
    nginx.requests:
      enabled: true
none_set:
  metrics:
    nginx.connections_accepted:
      enabled: false
    nginx.connections_current:
      enabled: false
    nginx.connections_handled:
      enabled: false
    nginx.requests:
      enabled: false

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: Collection interval for metrics.

fields.name: NodeConditionTypesToReport
fields.description: Node condition types to report. See all condition types, see here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#condition.

fields.name: AllocatableTypesToReport
fields.description: Allocate resource types to report. See all resource types, see here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#capacity

fields.name: MetadataExporters
fields.description: List of exporters to which metadata from this receiver should be forwarded to.

fields.name: Distribution
fields.description: Whether OpenShift support should be enabled or not.

fields.name: MetadataCollectionInterval
fields.description: Collection interval for metadata. Metadata of the particular entity in the cluster is collected when the entity changes. In addition metadata of all entities is collected periodically even if no changes happen. Setting the duration to 0 will disable periodic collection (however will not impact metadata collection on changes).

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Namespace
fields.description: Deprecated: This field is no longer supported, use cfg.Namespaces instead.

fields.name: Namespaces
fields.description: Namespaces to fetch resources from. If this is set, certain cluster-wide resources such as Nodes or Namespaces will not be able to be observed. Setting this option is recommended in environments where due to security restrictions the collector cannot be granted cluster-wide permissions.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending logs in case of receiving a retryable error from a downstream consumer. Default is false.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying. Default value is 1 second.

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`. Default value is 30 seconds.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a logs batch to a downstream consumer. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. It never stops if MaxElapsedTime == 0. Default value is 5 minutes.

fields.name: maxBatchSize
fields.description: currently not configurable by users, but available for benchmarking

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: EventsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: EventsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only events with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: EventsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: EventsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, events with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. EventsInclude has higher priority than EventsExclude.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    ntp.offset:
      enabled: true
  resource_attributes:
    ntp.host:
      enabled: true
none_set:

    ntp.offset:
      enabled: false
  resource_attributes:
    ntp.host:
      enabled: false
filter_set_include:
  resource_attributes:
    ntp.host:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
filter_set_exclude:
  resource_attributes:
    ntp.host:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "ntp.host-val"

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: MemoryLimitMiB
fields.description: MemoryLimitMiB is the size of a shared memory region used by all Arrow streams, in MiB.  When too much load is passing through, they will see ResourceExhausted errors.

fields.name: DeprecatedAdmissionLimitMiB
fields.description: Deprecated: This field is no longer supported, use cfg.Admission.RequestLimitMiB instead.

fields.name: DeprecatedWaiterLimit
fields.description: Deprecated: This field is no longer supported, use cfg.Admission.WaiterLimit instead.

fields.name: MemoryLimitMiB
fields.description: MemoryLimitMiB is a memory limit control for the decoder, as a way to limit overall memory use by Zstd. See `zstdlib.WithDecoderMaxMemory()`.

fields.name: MaxWindowSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxWindowSizeMiB limits window sizes that can be configured in the corresponding encoder's `EncoderConfig.WindowSizeMiB` setting, as a way to control memory usage. See `zstdlib.WithDecoderMaxWindow()`.

fields.name: Concurrency
fields.description: Concurrency is a Zstd-library parameter that configures the use of background goroutines to improve decompression speed. 0 means to let the library decide (it will use up to GOMAXPROCS), and 1 means to avoid background workers.  (default: 1) See `zstdlib.WithDecoderConcurrency()`.

fields.name: RequestLimitMiB
fields.description: RequestLimitMiB limits the number of requests that are received by the stream based on uncompressed request size. Request size is used to control how much traffic we admit for processing.  When this field is zero, admission control is disabled.

fields.name: WaitingLimitMiB
fields.description: WaitingLimitMiB is the limit on the amount of data waiting to be consumed. This is a dimension of memory limiting to ensure waiters are not consuming an unexpectedly large amount of memory in the arrow receiver.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: EventsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: EventsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only events with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: EventsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: EventsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, events with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. EventsInclude has higher priority than EventsExclude.

examples:
default:
all_set:
  metrics:
    postgresql.backends:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.bgwriter.buffers.allocated:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.bgwriter.buffers.writes:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.bgwriter.checkpoint.count:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.bgwriter.duration:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.bgwriter.maxwritten:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.blks_hit:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.blks_read:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.blocks_read:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.commits:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.connection.max:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.database.count:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.database.locks:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.db_size:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.deadlocks:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.function.calls:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.index.scans:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.index.size:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.operations:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.replication.data_delay:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.rollbacks:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.rows:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.sequential_scans:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.table.count:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.table.size:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.table.vacuum.count:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.temp.io:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.temp_files:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.tup_deleted:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.tup_fetched:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.tup_inserted:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.tup_returned:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.tup_updated:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.wal.age:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.wal.delay:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.wal.lag:
      enabled: true

    db.server.query_sample:
      enabled: true
    db.server.top_query:
      enabled: true
  resource_attributes:

      enabled: true
    postgresql.index.name:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.schema.name:
      enabled: true
    postgresql.table.name:
      enabled: true

      enabled: false
    postgresql.bgwriter.buffers.allocated:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.bgwriter.buffers.writes:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.bgwriter.checkpoint.count:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.bgwriter.duration:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.bgwriter.maxwritten:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.blks_hit:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.blks_read:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.blocks_read:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.commits:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.connection.max:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.database.count:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.database.locks:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.db_size:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.deadlocks:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.function.calls:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.index.scans:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.index.size:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.operations:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.replication.data_delay:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.rollbacks:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.rows:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.sequential_scans:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.table.count:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.table.size:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.table.vacuum.count:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.temp.io:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.temp_files:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.tup_deleted:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.tup_fetched:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.tup_inserted:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.tup_returned:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.tup_updated:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.wal.age:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.wal.delay:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.wal.lag:
      enabled: false
  events:
    db.server.query_sample:
      enabled: false
    db.server.top_query:
      enabled: false
  resource_attributes:
    postgresql.database.name:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.index.name:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.schema.name:
      enabled: false
    postgresql.table.name:
      enabled: false
filter_set_include:
  resource_attributes:
    postgresql.database.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
      events_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
    postgresql.index.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
      events_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
    postgresql.schema.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
      events_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
    postgresql.table.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
      events_include:
        - regexp: ".*"
filter_set_exclude:
  resource_attributes:
    postgresql.database.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.database.name-val"
      events_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.database.name-val"
    postgresql.index.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.index.name-val"
      events_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.index.name-val"
    postgresql.schema.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.schema.name-val"
      events_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.schema.name-val"
    postgresql.table.name:
      enabled: true
      metrics_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.table.name-val"
      events_exclude:
        - strict: "postgresql.table.name-val"

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Configure the service URL for the Pulsar service.

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: The topic of pulsar to consume logs,metrics,traces. (default = "otlp_traces" for traces, "otlp_metrics" for metrics, "otlp_logs" for logs)

fields.name: Subscription
fields.description: The Subscription that receiver will be consuming messages from (default "otlp_subscription")

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding of the messages (default "otlp_proto")

fields.name: ConsumerName
fields.description: Name specifies the consumer name.

fields.name: TLSTrustCertsFilePath
fields.description: Set the path to the trusted TLS certificate file

fields.name: TLSAllowInsecureConnection
fields.description: Configure whether the Pulsar client accept untrusted TLS certificate from broker (default: false)

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: WatchObservers
fields.description: WatchObservers are the extensions to listen to endpoints from.

fields.name: ResourceAttributes
fields.description: ResourceAttributes is a map of default resource attributes to add to each resource object received by this receiver from dynamically created receivers.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint is the SNMP target to request data from. Must be formatted as [udp|tcp|][4|6|]://{host}:{port}. Default: udp://localhost:161 If no scheme is given, udp4 is assumed. If no port is given, 161 is assumed.

fields.name: Version
fields.description: Version is the version of SNMP to use for this connection. Valid options: v1, v2c, v3. Default: v2c

fields.name: Community
fields.description: Community is the SNMP community string to use. Only valid for versions "v1" and "v2c" Default: public

fields.name: User
fields.description: User is the SNMP User for this connection. Only valid for version v3

fields.name: SecurityLevel
fields.description: SecurityLevel is the security level to use for this SNMP connection. Only valid for version v3 Valid options: no_auth_no_priv, auth_no_priv, auth_priv Default: "no_auth_no_priv"

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: AuthType is the type of authentication protocol to use for this SNMP connection. Only valid for version v3 and if no_auth_no_priv is not selected for SecurityLevel Valid options: md5, sha, sha224, sha256, sha384, sha512 Default: "md5"

fields.name: AuthPassword
fields.description: AuthPassword is the authentication password used for this SNMP connection. Only valid for version "v3" and if "no_auth_no_priv" is not selected for SecurityLevel

fields.name: PrivacyType
fields.description: PrivacyType is the type of privacy protocol to use for this SNMP connection. Only valid for version v3 and if "auth_priv" is selected for SecurityLevel Valid options: des, aes, aes192, aes256, aes192c, aes256c Default: "des"

fields.name: PrivacyPassword
fields.description: PrivacyPassword is the authentication password used for this SNMP connection. Only valid for version v3 and if "auth_priv" is selected for SecurityLevel

fields.name: ResourceAttributes
fields.description: ResourceAttributes defines what resource attributes will be used for this receiver and is composed of resource attribute names along with their resource attribute configurations

fields.name: Attributes
fields.description: Attributes defines what attributes will be used on metrics for this receiver and is composed of attribute names along with their attribute configurations

fields.name: Metrics
fields.description: Metrics defines what SNMP metrics will be collected for this receiver and is composed of metric names along with their metric configurations

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. The address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Arrays
fields.description: Arrays represents the list of arrays to query

fields.name: Clients
fields.description: Clients represents the list of clients metrics

fields.name: Usage
fields.description: Usage represents the list of usage to query

fields.name: Env
fields.description: Env represents the respective environment value valid to scrape

fields.name: CollectionInterval
fields.description: CollectionInterval sets how frequently the scraper should be called and used as the context timeout to ensure that scrapers don't exceed the interval.

fields.name: InitialDelay
fields.description: InitialDelay sets the initial start delay for the scraper, any non positive value is assumed to be immediately.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is an optional value used to set scraper's context deadline.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Optional username. Use the specified Username to authenticate the current connection with one of the connections defined in the ACL list when connecting to a Redis 6.0 instance, or greater, that is using the Redis ACL system.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Optional password. Must match the password specified in the requirepass server configuration option, or the user's password when connecting to a Redis 6.0 instance, or greater, that is using the Redis ACL system.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.

fields.name: MetricsInclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsInclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, only metrics with matching resource attribute values will be emitted.

fields.name: MetricsExclude
fields.description: Experimental: MetricsExclude defines a list of filters for attribute values. If the list is not empty, metrics with matching resource attribute values will not be emitted. MetricsInclude has higher priority than MetricsExclude.
