fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: onPanic
fields.description: default is WriteThenPanic

fields.name: onFatal
fields.description: default is WriteThenFatal

fields.name: NumberOfWorkers
fields.description: Maximum number of concurrent calls to AWS X-Ray to upload documents.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: X-Ray service endpoint to which the collector sends segment documents.

fields.name: RequestTimeoutSeconds
fields.description: Number of seconds before timing out a request.

fields.name: MaxRetries
fields.description: Maximum number of retries before abandoning an attempt to post data.

fields.name: NoVerifySSL
fields.description: Enable or disable TLS certificate verification.

fields.name: ProxyAddress
fields.description: Upload segments to AWS X-Ray through a proxy.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Send segments to AWS X-Ray service in a specific region.

fields.name: LocalMode
fields.description: Local mode to skip EC2 instance metadata check.

fields.name: ResourceARN
fields.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS resource running the collector.

fields.name: RoleARN
fields.description: IAM role to upload segments to a different account.

fields.name: ExternalID
fields.description: External ID to verify third party role assumption

fields.description: Export raw log string instead of log wrapper Required for emf logs

fields.name: IndexedAttributes
fields.description: By default, OpenTelemetry attributes are converted to X-Ray metadata, which are not indexed. Specify a list of attribute names to be converted to X-Ray annotations instead, which will be indexed. See annotation vs. metadata: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/xray/latest/devguide/xray-concepts.html#xray-concepts-annotations

fields.name: IndexAllAttributes
fields.description: Set to true to convert all OpenTelemetry attributes to X-Ray annotation (indexed) ignoring the IndexedAttributes option. Default value: false

fields.name: skipTimestampValidation
fields.description: skipTimestampValidation if enabled, will skip timestamp validation logic on the trace ID

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. The address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle TCP connections the client can keep open. Default value is 100. If `sending_queue` is enabled, it is recommended to use same value as `sending_queue::num_consumers`.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to convert resource attributes to telemetry attributes. Default is `false`.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime

This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Logs
fields.description: Logs is the table name for logs.

fields.name: Traces
fields.description: Traces is the table name for traces.

fields.name: Metrics
fields.description: Metrics is the table name for metrics.

fields.name: Database
fields.description: Database is the database name.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username is the authentication username.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password is the authentication password.

fields.name: CreateSchema
fields.description: CreateSchema is whether databases and tables are created automatically.

fields.name: MySQLEndpoint
fields.description: MySQLEndpoint is the mysql protocol address to create the schema; ignored if create_schema is false.

fields.name: HistoryDays
fields.description: Data older than these days will be deleted; ignored if create_schema is false. If set to 0, historical data will not be deleted.

fields.name: CreateHistoryDays
fields.description: The number of days in the history partition that was created when the table was created; ignored if create_schema is false. If history_days is not 0, create_history_days needs to be less than or equal to history_days.

fields.name: ReplicationNum
fields.description: ReplicationNum is the number of replicas of the table; ignored if create_schema is false.

fields.name: TimeZone
fields.description: Timezone is the timezone of the doris.

fields.name: LogResponse
fields.description: LogResponse is whether to log the response of doris stream load.

fields.name: LabelPrefix
fields.description: LabelPrefix is the prefix of the label in doris stream load.

fields.name: LogProgressInterval
fields.description: ProgressInterval is the interval of the progress reporter.

fields.name: extend
fields.description: The tzdata information can be followed by a string that describes how to handle DST transitions not recorded in zoneTrans. The format is the TZ environment variable without a colon; see https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/V1_chap08.html. Example string, for America/Los_Angeles: PST8PDT,M3.2.0,M11.1.0

fields.name: cacheStart
fields.description: Most lookups will be for the current time. To avoid the binary search through tx, keep a static one-element cache that gives the correct zone for the time when the Location was created. if cacheStart <= t < cacheEnd, lookup can return cacheZone. The units for cacheStart and cacheEnd are seconds since January 1, 1970 UTC, to match the argument to lookup.

fields.name: name
fields.description: abbreviated name, "CET"

fields.name: offset
fields.description: seconds east of UTC

fields.name: isDST
fields.description: is this zone Daylight Savings Time?

fields.name: NumberOfWorkers
fields.description: Maximum number of concurrent calls to AWS X-Ray to upload documents.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: X-Ray service endpoint to which the collector sends segment documents.

fields.name: RequestTimeoutSeconds
fields.description: Number of seconds before timing out a request.

fields.name: MaxRetries
fields.description: Maximum number of retries before abandoning an attempt to post data.

fields.name: NoVerifySSL
fields.description: Enable or disable TLS certificate verification.

fields.name: ProxyAddress
fields.description: Upload segments to AWS X-Ray through a proxy.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Send segments to AWS X-Ray service in a specific region.

fields.name: LocalMode
fields.description: Local mode to skip EC2 instance metadata check.

fields.name: ResourceARN
fields.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS resource running the collector.

fields.name: RoleARN
fields.description: IAM role to upload segments to a different account.

fields.name: ExternalID
fields.description: External ID to verify third party role assumption

fields.name: LogGroupName
fields.description: LogGroupName is the name of CloudWatch log group which defines group of log streams that share the same retention, monitoring, and access control settings.

fields.name: LogStreamName
fields.description: LogStreamName is the name of CloudWatch log stream which is a sequence of log events that share the same source.

fields.name: Namespace
fields.description: Namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics. Metrics in different namespaces are isolated from each other.

fields.name: RetainInitialValueOfDeltaMetric
fields.description: RetainInitialValueOfDeltaMetric is the flag to signal that the initial value of a metric is a valid datapoint. The default behavior is that the first value occurrence of a metric is set as the baseline for the calculation of the delta to the next occurrence. With this flag set to true the exporter will instead use this first value as the initial delta value. This is especially useful when handling low frequency metrics.

fields.name: DimensionRollupOption
fields.description: DimensionRollupOption is the option for metrics dimension rollup. Three options are available, default option is "ZeroAndSingleDimensionRollup". "ZeroAndSingleDimensionRollup" - Enable both zero dimension rollup and single dimension rollup "SingleDimensionRollupOnly" - Enable single dimension rollup "NoDimensionRollup" - No dimension rollup (only keep original metrics which contain all dimensions)

fields.name: LogRetention
fields.description: LogRetention is the option to set the log retention policy for the CloudWatch Log Group. Defaults to Never Expire if not specified or set to 0 Possible values are 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 365, 400, 545, 731, 1827, 2192, 2557, 2922, 3288, or 3653

fields.name: Tags
fields.description: Tags is the option to set tags for the CloudWatch Log Group.  If specified, please add at most 50 tags.  Input is a string to string map like so: { 'key': 'value' } Keys must be between 1-128 characters and follow the regex pattern: ^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]+)$ Values must be between 1-256 characters and follow the regex pattern: ^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$

fields.name: ParseJSONEncodedAttributeValues
fields.description: ParseJSONEncodedAttributeValues is an array of attribute keys whose corresponding values are JSON-encoded as strings. Those strings will be decoded to its original json structure.

fields.name: MetricDeclarations
fields.description: MetricDeclarations is the list of rules to be used to set dimensions for exported metrics.

fields.name: MetricDescriptors
fields.description: MetricDescriptors is the list of override metric descriptors that are sent to the CloudWatch

fields.name: OutputDestination
fields.description: OutputDestination is an option to specify the EMFExporter output. Default option is "cloudwatch" "cloudwatch" - direct the exporter output to CloudWatch backend "stdout" - direct the exporter output to stdout TODO: we can support directing output to a file (in the future) while customer specifies a file path here.

fields.name: EKSFargateContainerInsightsEnabled
fields.description: EKSFargateContainerInsightsEnabled is an option to reformat certin metric labels so that they take the form of a high level object The end result will make the labels look like those coming out of ECS and be more easily injected into cloudwatch Note that at the moment in order to use this feature the value "kubernetes" must also be added to the ParseJSONEncodedAttributeValues array in order to be used

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to convert resource attributes to telemetry attributes. Default is `false`.

fields.name: DetailedMetrics
fields.description: DetailedMetrics is an option for retaining detailed datapoint values in exported metrics (e.g instead of exporting a quantile as a statistical value, preserve the quantile's population)

fields.name: Version
fields.description: Version is an option for sending metrics to CloudWatchLogs with Embedded Metric Format in selected version  (with "_aws") https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/CloudWatch_Embedded_Metric_Format_Specification.html#CloudWatch_Embedded_Metric_Format_Specification_structure Otherwise, sending metrics as Embedded Metric Format version 0 (without "_aws")

fields.name: onPanic
fields.description: default is WriteThenPanic

fields.name: onFatal
fields.description: default is WriteThenFatal

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: Path of the file to write to. Path is relative to current directory.

fields.name: Append
fields.description: Mode defines whether the exporter should append to the file. Options: - false[default]:  truncates the file - true:  appends to the file.

fields.name: MaxMegabytes
fields.description: MaxMegabytes is the maximum size in megabytes of the file before it gets rotated. It defaults to 100 megabytes.

fields.name: MaxDays
fields.description: MaxDays is the maximum number of days to retain old log files based on the timestamp encoded in their filename.  Note that a day is defined as 24 hours and may not exactly correspond to calendar days due to daylight savings, leap seconds, etc. The default is not to remove old log files based on age.

fields.name: MaxBackups
fields.description: MaxBackups is the maximum number of old log files to retain. The default is to 100 files.

fields.name: LocalTime
fields.description: LocalTime determines if the time used for formatting the timestamps in backup files is the computer's local time.  The default is to use UTC time.

fields.name: FormatType
fields.description: FormatType define the data format of encoded telemetry data Options: - json[default]:  OTLP json bytes. - proto:  OTLP binary protobuf bytes.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: Compression Codec used to export telemetry data Supported compression algorithms:`zstd`

fields.name: FlushInterval
fields.description: FlushInterval is the duration between flushes. See time.ParseDuration for valid values.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enables group_by. When group_by is enabled, rotation setting is ignored.  Default is false.

fields.name: ResourceAttribute
fields.description: ResourceAttribute specifies the name of the resource attribute that contains the path segment of the file to write to. The final path will be the Path config value, with the * replaced with the value of this resource attribute. Default is "fileexporter.path_segment".

fields.name: MaxOpenFiles
fields.description: MaxOpenFiles specifies the maximum number of open file descriptors for the output files. The default is 100.

fields.name: collectorVersion
fields.description: collectorVersion is the build version of the collector. This is overridden when an exporter is initialized.

fields.name: ConnectionParams

fields.name: LogsTableName
fields.description: LogsTableName is the table name for logs. default is `otel_logs`.

fields.name: TracesTableName
fields.description: TracesTableName is the table name for traces. default is `otel_traces`.

fields.name: MetricsTableName
fields.description: MetricsTableName is the table name for metrics. default is `otel_metrics`. Deprecated: MetricsTableName exists for historical compatibility and should not be used. To set the metrics tables name, use the MetricsTables parameter instead.

fields.name: TTL
fields.description: TTL is The data time-to-live example 30m, 48h. 0 means no ttl.

fields.name: ClusterName
fields.description: ClusterName if set will append `ON CLUSTER` with the provided name when creating tables.

fields.name: CreateSchema
fields.description: CreateSchema if set to true will run the DDL for creating the database and tables. default is true.

fields.name: Compress
fields.description: Compress controls the compression algorithm. Valid options: `none` (disabled), `zstd`, `lz4` (default), `gzip`, `deflate`, `br`, `true` (lz4).

fields.name: AsyncInsert

fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: ProjectID
fields.description: Google Cloud Project ID where the Pubsub client will connect to

fields.name: UserAgent
fields.description: User agent that will be used by the Pubsub client to connect to the service

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Override of the Pubsub Endpoint, leave empty for the default endpoint

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: Only has effect if Endpoint is not ""

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: The fully qualified resource name of the Pubsub topic

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: Compression of the payload (only gzip or is supported, no compression is the default)

fields.name: Behavior
fields.description: Behavior of the watermark. Currently, only of the message (none, earliest and current, current being the default) will set the timestamp on pubsub based on timestamps of the events inside the message

fields.name: AllowedDrift
fields.description: Indication on how much the timestamp can drift from the current time, the timestamp will be capped to the allowed maximum. A duration of 0 is the same as maximum duration

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates if ordering is enabled

fields.name: FromResourceAttribute
fields.description: FromResourceAttribute is a resource attribute that will be used as the ordering key.

fields.name: RemoveResourceAttribute
fields.description: RemoveResourceAttribute indicates if the ordering key should be removed from the resource attributes.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to convert resource attributes to telemetry attributes. Default is `false`.

fields.name: ResourceMappingOperation
fields.description: Operation to be performed for resource mapping. Valid values are `and`, `or`.

fields.name: Brokers
fields.description: Brokers holds the list of Kafka bootstrap servers (default localhost:9092).

fields.name: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly
fields.description: ResolveCanonicalBootstrapServersOnly configures the Kafka client to perform a DNS lookup on each of the provided brokers, and then perform a reverse lookup on the resulting IPs to obtain the canonical hostnames to use as the bootstrap servers. This can be required in SASL environments.

fields.name: ProtocolVersion
fields.description: ProtocolVersion defines the Kafka protocol version that the client will assume it is running against.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: ClientID holds the client ID advertised to Kafka, which can be used for enforcing ACLs, throttling quotas, and more (default "otel-collector")

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username to be used on authentication

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password to be used on authentication

fields.name: Mechanism
fields.description: SASL Mechanism to be used, possible values are: (PLAIN, AWS_MSK_IAM_OAUTHBEARER, SCRAM-SHA-256 or SCRAM-SHA-512).

fields.name: Version
fields.description: SASL Protocol Version to be used, possible values are: (0, 1). Defaults to 0.

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region is the AWS region the MSK cluster is based in

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: Full
fields.description: Whether to maintain a full set of metadata for all topics, or just the minimal set that has been necessary so far. The full set is simpler and usually more convenient, but can take up a substantial amount of memory if you have many topics and partitions. Defaults to true.

fields.name: RefreshInterval
fields.description: RefreshInterval controls the frequency at which cluster metadata is refreshed. Defaults to 10 minutes.

fields.name: Max
fields.description: The total number of times to retry a metadata request when the cluster is in the middle of a leader election or at startup (default 3).

fields.name: Backoff
fields.description: How long to wait for leader election to occur before retrying (default 250ms). Similar to the JVM's `retry.backoff.ms`.

fields.name: RackID
fields.description: RackID provides the rack identifier for this client to enable rack-aware replica selection when supported by the brokers. This maps to Kafka's standard "client.rack" setting. By default, this is empty.

fields.name: MaxMessageBytes
fields.description: Maximum message bytes the producer will accept to produce (default 1000000)

fields.name: RequiredAcks
fields.description: RequiredAcks holds the number acknowledgements required before producing returns successfully. See: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/producer-configs.html#acks Acceptable values are:   0 (NoResponse)   Does not wait for any acknowledgements.   1 (WaitForLocal) Waits for only the leader to write the record to its local log,                    but does not wait for followers to acknowledge. (default)  -1 (WaitForAll)   Waits for all in-sync replicas to acknowledge.                    In YAML configuration, "all" is accepted as an alias for -1.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: Compression Codec used to produce messages https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/IBM/sarama@v1.30.0#CompressionCodec The options are: 'none' (default), 'gzip', 'snappy', 'lz4', and 'zstd'

fields.name: FlushMaxMessages
fields.description: The maximum number of messages the producer will send in a single broker request. Defaults to 0 for unlimited. Similar to `queue.buffering.max.messages` in the JVM producer.

fields.name: AllowAutoTopicCreation
fields.description: Whether or not to allow automatic topic creation. (default enabled).

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: Topic holds the name of the Kafka topic to which messages of the signal type should be produced. The default depends on the signal type:  - "otlp_spans" for traces  - "otlp_metrics" for metrics  - "otlp_logs" for logs  - "otlp_profiles" for profiles

fields.name: TopicFromMetadataKey
fields.description: TopicFromMetadataKey holds the name of the metadata key to use as the topic name for this signal type. If this is set, it takes precedence over the topic name set in the topic field.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the encoding of messages for the signal type. Defaults to "otlp_proto".

Deprecated [v0.124.0]: use logs::topic, metrics::topic, and traces::topic instead.

fields.name: IncludeMetadataKeys
fields.description: IncludeMetadataKeys indicates the receiver's client metadata keys to propagate as Kafka message headers.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Encoding holds the encoding of Kafka message values. Encoding has no default. If explicitly specified, it will take precedence over the default values of logs::encoding, metrics::encoding, and traces::encoding. Deprecated [v0.124.0]: use logs::encoding, metrics::encoding, and traces::encoding instead.

fields.name: PartitionTracesByID
fields.description: PartitionTracesByID sets the message key of outgoing trace messages to the trace ID. NOTE: this does not have any effect for Jaeger encodings. Jaeger encodings always use use the trace ID for the message key.

fields.name: PartitionMetricsByResourceAttributes
fields.description: PartitionMetricsByResourceAttributes controls the partitioning of metrics messages by resource. If this is true, then the message key will be set to a hash of the resource's identifying attributes.

fields.name: PartitionLogsByResourceAttributes
fields.description: PartitionLogsByResourceAttributes controls the partitioning of logs messages by resource. If this is true, then the message key will be set to a hash of the resource's identifying attributes.

fields.name: SpanDimensions
fields.description: SpanDimensions are span attributes to be used as line protocol tags. These are always included as tags: - trace ID - span ID The default values are strongly recommended for use with Jaeger: - service.name - span.name Other common attributes can be found here: - https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/

fields.name: LogRecordDimensions
fields.description: LogRecordDimensions are log record attributes to be used as line protocol tags. These are always included as tags, if available: - trace ID - span ID The default values: - service.name Other common attributes can be found here: - https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/ When using InfluxDB for both logs and traces, be certain that log_record_dimensions matches the tracing span_dimensions value.

fields.name: MetricsSchema
fields.description: MetricsSchema indicates the metrics schema to emit to line protocol. Options: - telegraf-prometheus-v1 - telegraf-prometheus-v2

fields.description: PayloadMaxLines is the maximum number of line protocol lines to POST in a single request.

fields.name: PayloadMaxBytes

fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoints
fields.description: Endpoints holds the Elasticsearch URLs the exporter should send events to. This setting is required if CloudID is not set and if the ELASTICSEARCH_URL environment variable is not set.

fields.name: CloudID
fields.description: CloudID holds the cloud ID to identify the Elastic Cloud cluster to send events to. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-cloud-id.html This setting is required if no URL is configured.

fields.name: NumWorkers
fields.description: NumWorkers configures the number of workers publishing bulk requests.

fields.name: LogsIndex
fields.description: LogsIndex configures the static index used for document routing for logs. It should be empty if dynamic document routing is preferred.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled enables dynamic index routing. Deprecated: [v0.122.0] This config is now ignored. Dynamic index routing is always done by default.

fields.name: MetricsIndex
fields.description: MetricsIndex configures the static index used for document routing for metrics. It should be empty if dynamic document routing is preferred.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled enables dynamic index routing. Deprecated: [v0.122.0] This config is now ignored. Dynamic index routing is always done by default.

fields.name: TracesIndex
fields.description: TracesIndex configures the static index used for document routing for metrics. It should be empty if dynamic document routing is preferred.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled enables dynamic index routing. Deprecated: [v0.122.0] This config is now ignored. Dynamic index routing is always done by default.

fields.name: Pipeline
fields.description: Pipeline configures the ingest node pipeline name that should be used to process the events. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/ingest.html

fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: User
fields.description: User is used to configure HTTP Basic Authentication.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password is used to configure HTTP Basic Authentication.

fields.name: APIKey
fields.description: APIKey is used to configure ApiKey based Authentication. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/security-api-create-api-key.html

fields.name: OnStart
fields.description: OnStart, if set, instructs the exporter to look for available Elasticsearch nodes the first time the exporter connects to the cluster.

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: Interval instructs the exporter to renew the list of Elasticsearch URLs with the given interval. URLs will not be updated if Interval is <=0.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled allows users to disable retry without having to comment out all settings.

fields.name: MaxRequests
fields.description: MaxRequests configures how often an HTTP request is attempted before it is assumed to be failed. Deprecated: use MaxRetries instead.

fields.name: MaxRetries
fields.description: MaxRetries configures how many times an HTTP request is retried.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval configures the initial waiting time if a request failed.

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval configures the max waiting time if consecutive requests failed.

fields.name: RetryOnStatus
fields.description: RetryOnStatus configures the status codes that trigger request or document level retries.

fields.name: Bytes
fields.description: Bytes sets the send buffer flushing limit.

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: Interval configures the max age of a document in the send buffer.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Mode configures the default document mapping mode. The mode may be overridden in two ways:  - by the client metadata key X-Elastic-Mapping-Mode, if specified  - by the scope attribute elastic.mapping.mode, if specified The order of precedence is:   scope attribute > client metadata > default mode.

fields.name: AllowedModes
fields.description: AllowedModes controls the allowed document mapping modes specified through X-Elastic-Mapping-Mode client metadata. If unspecified, all mapping modes are allowed.

fields.name: IncludeSourceOnError
fields.description: IncludeSourceOnError configures whether the bulk index responses include a part of the source document on error. Defaults to nil. This setting requires Elasticsearch 8.18+. Using it in prior versions have no effect. NOTE: The default behavior if this configuration is not set, is to discard the error reason entirely, i.e. only the error type is returned. WARNING: If set to true, the exporter may log error responses containing request payload, causing potential sensitive data to be exposed in logs. Users are expected to sanitize the responses themselves.

fields.name: enabledSet
fields.description: enabledSet tracks whether Enabled has been specified. If enabledSet is false, the exporter will perform its own buffering.

fields.name: MetadataKeys
fields.description: Experimental: MetadataKeys defines a list of client.Metadata keys that will be used as partition keys for when batcher is enabled and will be added to the exporter's telemetry if defined. The config only applies when `sending_queue::batch` is defined or when the, now deprecated, batcher is used (set to `true` or `false`). The metadata keys are converted to lower case as key lookups for client metadata is case insensitive. This means that the metric produced by internal telemetry will also have the attribute in lower case. Keys are case-insensitive and duplicates will trigger a validation error.

fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target to which the exporter is going to send traces or metrics, using the gRPC protocol. The valid syntax is described at https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC client. See grpc.WithReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC gRPC. See grpc.WithWriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithWriteBufferSize).

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC client.

fields.name: RoutingKey
fields.description: RoutingKey is a single routing key value

fields.name: RoutingAttributes
fields.description: RoutingAttributes creates a composite routing key, based on several resource attributes of the application. Supports all attributes available (both resource and span), as well as the pseudo attributes "span.kind" and "span.name".

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description: Mode configures the field mappings. Supported modes are the following:   ss4o: exports logs in the Simple Schema for Observability standard.   This mode is enabled by default.   See: https://opensearch.org/docs/latest/observing-your-data/ss4o/   ecs: maps fields defined in the OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions   to the Elastic Common Schema.   See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/ecs/current/index.html   flatten_attributes: uses the ECS mapping but flattens all resource and   log attributes in the record to the top-level.

fields.name: Fields
fields.description: Additional field mappings.

fields.name: File
fields.description: File to read additional fields mappings from.

fields.name: TimestampField
fields.description: Field to store timestamp in.  If not set uses the default @timestamp

fields.name: UnixTimestamp
fields.description: Whether to store timestamp in Epoch milliseconds

fields.name: Dedup
fields.description: Try to find and remove duplicate fields

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.description: The Observability indices would follow the recommended for immutable data stream ingestion pattern using the data_stream concepts. fields.description: QueueSize is the maximum number of OTLP metric batches allowed in the queue at a given time. Ignored if Enabled is false.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumWorkers configures the number of workers used by the collector to fan out remote write requests.

fields.name: ExternalLabels
fields.description: ExternalLabels defines a map of label keys and values that are allowed to start with reserved prefix "__"

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: MaxBatchSizeBytes
fields.description: maximum size in bytes of time series batch sent to remote storage

fields.name: MaxBatchRequestParallelism
fields.description: maximum amount of parallel requests to do when handling large batch request

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to convert resource attributes to telemetry attributes. Default is `false`.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if false the target_info metric is not generated by the exporter

fields.name: AddMetricSuffixes
fields.description: AddMetricSuffixes controls whether unit and type suffixes are added to metrics on export

fields.name: SendMetadata
fields.description: SendMetadata controls whether prometheus metadata will be generated and sent, this option is ignored when using PRW 2.0, which always includes metadata.

fields.name: RemoteWriteProtoMsg
fields.description: RemoteWriteProtoMsg controls whether prometheus remote write v1 or v2 is sent.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Namespace
fields.description: Namespace if set, exports metrics under the provided value.

fields.name: ConstLabels
fields.description: ConstLabels are values that are applied for every exported metric.

fields.name: SendTimestamps
fields.description: SendTimestamps will send the underlying scrape timestamp with the export

fields.name: MetricExpiration
fields.description: MetricExpiration defines how long metrics are kept without updates

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to convert resource attributes to telemetry attributes. Default is `false`.

fields.name: EnableOpenMetrics
fields.description: EnableOpenMetrics enables the use of the OpenMetrics encoding option for the prometheus exporter.

fields.name: AddMetricSuffixes
fields.description: AddMetricSuffixes controls whether suffixes are added to metric names. Defaults to true. Deprecated: Use TranslationStrategy instead. This setting is ignored when TranslationStrategy is explicitly set.

fields.name: TranslationStrategy
fields.description: TranslationStrategy controls how OTLP metric and attribute names are translated into Prometheus metric and label names. When set, this takes precedence over AddMetricSuffixes.

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Prefix configures the prefix of metrics sent to GoogleManagedPrometheus.  Defaults to prometheus.googleapis.com. Changing this prefix is not recommended, as it may cause metrics to not be queryable with promql in the Cloud Monitoring UI.

fields.name: GetClientOptions
fields.description: GetClientOptions returns additional options to be passed to the underlying Google Cloud API client. Must be set programmatically (no support via declarative config). If GetClientOptions returns any options, the exporter will not add the default credentials, as those could conflict with options provided via GetClientOptions. Optional.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: Compression specifies the compression format for Metrics and Logging gRPC requests. Supported values: gzip.

fields.name: UseInsecure
fields.description: Only has effect if Endpoint is not ""

fields.name: GRPCPoolSize
fields.description: GRPCPoolSize sets the size of the connection pool in the GCP client

fields.name: CumulativeNormalization
fields.description: CumulativeNormalization normalizes cumulative metrics without start times or with explicit reset points by subtracting subsequent points from the initial point. It is enabled by default. Since it caches starting points, it may result in increased memory usage.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the timeout for every attempt to send data to the backend. A zero timeout means no timeout.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: MinSize
