fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target to which the exporter is going to send traces or metrics, using the gRPC protocol. The valid syntax is described at https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC client. See grpc.WithReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC gRPC. See grpc.WithWriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithWriteBufferSize).

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: LogDataEnabled
fields.description: LogDataEnabled can be used to disable sending logs by the exporter.

fields.name: ProfilingDataEnabled
fields.description: ProfilingDataEnabled can be used to disable sending profiling data by the exporter.

fields.name: Token
fields.description: HEC Token is the authentication token provided by Splunk: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Data/UsetheHTTPEventCollector.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: Optional Splunk source: https://docs.splunk.com/Splexicon:Source. Sources identify the incoming data.

fields.name: SourceType
fields.description: Optional Splunk source type: https://docs.splunk.com/Splexicon:Sourcetype.

fields.name: Index
fields.description: Splunk index, optional name of the Splunk index.

fields.name: DisableCompression
fields.description: Disable GZip compression. Defaults to false.

fields.name: MaxContentLengthLogs
fields.description: Maximum log payload size in bytes. Default value is 2097152 bytes (2MiB). Maximum allowed value is 838860800 (~ 800 MB).

fields.name: MaxContentLengthMetrics
fields.description: Maximum metric payload size in bytes. Default value is 2097152 bytes (2MiB). Maximum allowed value is 838860800 (~ 800 MB).

fields.name: MaxContentLengthTraces
fields.description: Maximum trace payload size in bytes. Default value is 2097152 bytes (2MiB). Maximum allowed value is 838860800 (~ 800 MB).

fields.name: MaxEventSize
fields.description: Maximum payload size, raw uncompressed. Default value is 5242880 bytes (5MiB). Maximum allowed value is 838860800 (~ 800 MB).

fields.name: SplunkAppName
fields.description: App name is used to track telemetry information for Splunk App's using HEC by App name. Defaults to "OpenTelemetry Collector Contrib".

fields.name: SplunkAppVersion
fields.description: App version is used to track telemetry information for Splunk App's using HEC by App version. Defaults to the current OpenTelemetry Collector Contrib build version.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: Source indicates the mapping of the source field to a specific unified model attribute.

fields.name: SourceType
fields.description: SourceType indicates the mapping of the sourcetype field to a specific unified model attribute.

fields.description: Index indicates the mapping of the index field to a specific unified model attribute.

fields.description: SeverityText informs the exporter to map the severity text field to a specific HEC field.

fields.name: SeverityNumber
fields.description: SeverityNumber informs the exporter to map the severity number field to a specific HEC field.

fields.name: HealthPath
fields.description: HealthPath for health API, default is '/services/collector/health'

fields.name: HecHealthCheckEnabled
fields.description: HecHealthCheckEnabled can be used to verify Splunk HEC health on exporter's startup

fields.name: ExportRaw
fields.description: ExportRaw to send only the log's body, targeting a Splunk HEC raw endpoint.

fields.name: UseMultiMetricFormat
fields.description: UseMultiMetricFormat combines metric events to save space during ingestion.

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: Interval represents the time interval for the heartbeat interval. If nothing or 0 is set, heartbeat is not enabled. A heartbeat is an event sent to _internal index with metadata for the current collector/host.

fields.name: Startup
fields.description: Startup is used to send heartbeat events on exporter's startup.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled is the bool to enable telemetry inside splunk hec exporter

fields.name: OverrideMetricsNames
fields.description: OverrideMetricsNames is the map to override metrics for internal metrics in splunk hec exporter

fields.name: ExtraAttributes
fields.description: ExtraAttributes is the extra attributes for metrics inside splunk hex exporter

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: Max HTTP request body size in bytes before compression (if applied). By default 1MB is recommended.

fields.name: LogFormat
fields.description: Logs related configuration Format to post logs into Sumo. (default json)   * text - Logs will appear in Sumo Logic in text format.   * json - Logs will appear in Sumo Logic in json format.   * otlp - Logs will be send in otlp format and will appear in Sumo Logic:     * in json format if record level attributes exists     * in text format in case of no level attributes See Sumo Logic documentation for more details: https://help.sumologic.com/docs/send-data/opentelemetry-collector/data-source-configurations/mapping-records-resources/

fields.name: MetricFormat
fields.description: Metrics related configuration The format of metrics you will be sending, either otlp or prometheus (Default is otlp)

fields.name: DecomposeOtlpHistograms
fields.description: Decompose OTLP Histograms into individual metrics, similar to how they're represented in Prometheus format

fields.name: Client
fields.description: Sumo specific options Name of the client

fields.name: StickySessionEnabled
fields.description: StickySessionEnabled defines if sticky session support is enable. By default this is false.

fields.name: MaxNumPartition
fields.description: MaxNumPartition Specifies the maximum number of partitions that clients can acquire for this extension instance. Implementation defines how limit exceeding should be handled.

fields.name: MaxNumPendingAcksPerPartition
fields.description: MaxNumPendingAcksPerPartition Specifies the maximum number of ackIDs and their corresponding status information that are waiting to be queried in each partition.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target to which the exporter is going to send traces or metrics, using the gRPC protocol. The valid syntax is described at https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC client. See grpc.WithReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC gRPC. See grpc.WithWriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithWriteBufferSize).

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC client.

fields.name: NumStreams
fields.description: NumStreams determines the number of OTel Arrow streams.

fields.name: MaxStreamLifetime
fields.description: MaxStreamLifetime should be set to less than the value of grpc: keepalive: max_connection_age_grace plus the timeout.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: Level is meaningful in the range [0, 10].  No invalid values, they all map into 4 default configurations.  (default: 5) See `zstdlib.WithEncoderLevel()`.

fields.name: WindowSizeMiB
fields.description: WindowSizeMiB is a Zstd-library parameter that controls how much window of text is visible to the compressor at a time. It is the dominant factor that determines memory usage. If zero, the window size is determined by level.  (default: 0) See `zstdlib.WithWindowSize()`.

fields.name: Concurrency
fields.description: Concurrency is a Zstd-library parameter that configures the use of background goroutines to improve compression speed. 0 means to let the library decide (it will use up to GOMAXPROCS), and 1 means to avoid background workers.  (default: 1) See `zstdlib.WithEncoderConcurrency()`.

fields.name: PayloadCompression
fields.description: PayloadCompression is applied on the Arrow IPC stream internally and may have different results from using gRPC-level compression.  This is disabled by default, since gRPC-level compression is enabled by default.  This can be set to "zstd" to turn on Arrow-Zstd compression. Note that `Zstd` applies to gRPC, not Arrow compression.

fields.name: Disabled
fields.description: Disabled prevents using OTel-Arrow streams.  The exporter falls back to standard OTLP.

fields.name: DisableDowngrade
fields.description: DisableDowngrade prevents this exporter from fallback back to standard OTLP.  If the Arrow service is unavailable, it will retry and/or fail.

fields.name: Prioritizer
fields.description: Prioritizer is a policy name for how load is distributed across streams.

fields.name: UserDialOptions
fields.description: UserDialOptions cannot be configured via `mapstructure` schemes.  This is useful for custom purposes where the exporter is built and configured via code instead of yaml. Uses include custom dialer, custom user-agent, etc.

fields.name: MetadataKeys
fields.description: MetadataKeys is a list of client.Metadata keys that will be used to form distinct exporters.  If this setting is empty, a single exporter instance will be used.  When this setting is not empty, one exporter will be used per distinct combination of values for the listed metadata keys. Empty value and unset metadata are treated as distinct cases. Entries are case-insensitive.  Duplicated entries will trigger a validation error.

fields.name: MetadataCardinalityLimit
fields.description: MetadataCardinalityLimit indicates the maximum number of exporter instances that will be created through a distinct combination of MetadataKeys.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Header specifies the auth-header for the token. Defaults to "Authorization"

fields.name: Scheme
fields.description: Scheme specifies the auth-scheme for the token. Defaults to "Bearer"

fields.name: BearerToken
fields.description: BearerToken specifies the bearer token to use for every RPC.

fields.name: Tokens
fields.description: Tokens specifies multiple bearer tokens to use for every RPC.

fields.name: Filename
fields.description: Filename points to a file that contains the bearer token(s) to use for every RPC.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: if left empty, then it is system managed

fields.name: File
fields.description: Path to the htpasswd file.

fields.name: Inline
fields.description: Inline contents of the htpasswd file.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username holds the username to use for client authentication.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password holds the password to use for client authentication.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. The address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: ProxyAddress
fields.description: ProxyAddress defines the proxy address that the local TCP server forwards HTTP requests to AWS X-Ray backend through.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: Region
fields.description: Region is the AWS region the local TCP server forwards requests to.

fields.name: RoleARN
fields.description: RoleARN is the IAM role used by the local TCP server when communicating with the AWS X-Ray service.

fields.name: AWSEndpoint
fields.description: AWSEndpoint is the X-Ray service endpoint which the local TCP server forwards requests to.

fields.name: LocalMode
fields.description: LocalMode determines whether the EC2 instance metadata endpoint will be called or not. Set to `true` to skip EC2 instance metadata check.

fields.name: ServiceName
fields.description: ServiceName determines which service the requests are sent to. will be default to `xray`. This is mandatory for SigV4

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enqueue and batch before exporting.

fields.name: WaitForResult
fields.description: WaitForResult determines if incoming requests are blocked until the request is processed or not. Currently, this option is not available when persistent queue is configured using the storage configuration.

fields.name: QueueSize
fields.description: QueueSize represents the maximum data size allowed for concurrent storage and processing.

fields.name: BlockOnOverflow
fields.description: BlockOnOverflow determines the behavior when the component's TotalSize limit is reached. If true, the component will wait for space; otherwise, operations will immediately return a retryable error.

fields.name: NumConsumers
fields.description: NumConsumers is the maximum number of concurrent consumers from the queue. This applies across all different optional configurations from above (e.g. wait_for_result, blockOnOverflow, persistent, etc.). TODO: This will also control the maximum number of shards, when supported:  https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/issues/12473.

fields.name: FlushTimeout
fields.description: FlushTimeout sets the time after which a batch will be sent regardless of its size.

fields.name: MinSize
fields.description: MinSize defines the configuration for the minimum size of a batch.

fields.name: MaxSize
fields.description: MaxSize defines the configuration for the maximum size of a batch.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not retry sending batches in case of export failure.

fields.name: InitialInterval
fields.description: InitialInterval the time to wait after the first failure before retrying.

fields.name: RandomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor is a random factor used to calculate next backoffs Randomized interval = RetryInterval * (1  RandomizationFactor)

fields.name: Multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier is the value multiplied by the backoff interval bounds

fields.name: MaxInterval
fields.description: MaxInterval is the upper bound on backoff interval. Once this value is reached the delay between consecutive retries will always be `MaxInterval`.

fields.name: MaxElapsedTime
fields.description: MaxElapsedTime is the maximum amount of time (including retries) spent trying to send a request/batch. Once this value is reached, the data is discarded. If set to 0, the retries are never stopped.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target URL to send data to (e.g.: http://some.url:9411/v1/traces).

fields.name: ProxyURL
fields.description: ProxyURL setting for the collector

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.ReadBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for HTTP client. See http.Transport.WriteBufferSize. Default is 0.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout parameter configures `http.Client.Timeout`. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP request sent by the client. Existing header values are overwritten if collision happens. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: MaxIdleConns
fields.description: MaxIdleConns is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the client can keep open. By default, it is set to 100. Zero means no limit.

fields.name: MaxIdleConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxIdleConnsPerHost is used to set a limit to the maximum idle HTTP connections the host can keep open. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: MaxConnsPerHost
fields.description: MaxConnsPerHost limits the total number of connections per host, including connections in the dialing, active, and idle states. Default is 0 (unlimited).

fields.name: IdleConnTimeout
fields.description: IdleConnTimeout is the maximum amount of time a connection will remain open before closing itself. By default, it is set to 90 seconds.

fields.name: DisableKeepAlives
fields.description: DisableKeepAlives, if true, disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request. WARNING: enabling this option can result in significant overhead establishing a new HTTP(S) connection for every request. Before enabling this option please consider whether changes to idle connection settings can achieve your goal.

fields.name: HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout
fields.description: This is needed in case you run into https://github.com/golang/go/issues/59690 https://github.com/golang/go/issues/36026 HTTP2ReadIdleTimeout if the connection has been idle for the configured value send a ping frame for health check 0s means no health check will be performed.

fields.name: HTTP2PingTimeout
fields.description: HTTP2PingTimeout if there's no response to the ping within the configured value, the connection will be closed. If not set or set to 0, it defaults to 15s.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled if true, cookies from HTTP responses will be reused in further HTTP requests with the same server.

fields.name: ForceAttemptHTTP2
fields.description: Enabling ForceAttemptHTTP2 forces the HTTP transport to use the HTTP/2 protocol. By default, this is set to true. NOTE: HTTP/2 does not support settings such as MaxConnsPerHost, MaxIdleConnsPerHost and MaxIdleConns.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP client. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: AccessToken
fields.description: AccessToken is the authentication token provided by SignalFx.

fields.name: Realm
fields.description: Realm is the SignalFx realm where data is going to be sent to.

fields.name: IngestURL
fields.description: IngestURL is the destination to where SignalFx metrics will be sent to, it is intended for tests and debugging. The value of Realm is ignored if the URL is specified. The exporter will automatically append the appropriate path: "/v2/datapoint" for metrics, and "/v2/event" for events.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: APIURL
fields.description: APIURL is the destination to where SignalFx metadata will be sent. This value takes precedence over the value of Realm

fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: Insecure
fields.description: In gRPC and HTTP when set to true, this is used to disable the client transport security. See https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithInsecure for gRPC. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional, default false)

fields.name: InsecureSkipVerify
fields.description: InsecureSkipVerify will enable TLS but not verify the certificate.

fields.name: ServerName
fields.description: ServerName requested by client for virtual hosting. This sets the ServerName in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: LogDataPoints
fields.description: Whether to log datapoints dispatched to Splunk Observability Cloud

fields.name: LogDimensionUpdates
fields.description: Whether to log dimension updates being sent to SignalFx.

fields.name: AccessTokenPassthrough
fields.description: AccessTokenPassthrough indicates whether to associate datapoints with an organization access token received in request.

fields.name: DeltaTranslationTTL
fields.description: DeltaTranslationTTL specifies in seconds the max duration to keep the most recent datapoint for any `delta_metric` specified in TranslationRules. Default is 3600s.

fields.name: SyncHostMetadata
fields.description: SyncHostMetadata defines if the exporter should scrape host metadata and sends it as property updates to SignalFx backend. IMPORTANT: Host metadata synchronization relies on `resourcedetection` processor.            If this option is enabled make sure that `resourcedetection` processor            is enabled in the pipeline with one of the cloud provider detectors            or environment variable detector setting a unique value to            `host.name` attribute within your k8s cluster. Also keep override            And keep `override=true` in resourcedetection config.

fields.name: RootPath
fields.description: RootPath is the host's root directory used when syncing metadata; applies to linux only.

fields.name: ExcludeMetrics
fields.description: ExcludeMetrics defines dpfilter.MetricFilters that will determine metrics to be excluded from sending to SignalFx backend. If translations enabled with TranslationRules options, the exclusion will be applied on translated metrics.

fields.name: IncludeMetrics
fields.description: IncludeMetrics defines dpfilter.MetricFilters to override exclusion any of metric. This option can be used to included metrics that are otherwise dropped by default. See ./translation/default_metrics.go for a list of metrics that are dropped by default.

fields.name: ExcludeProperties
fields.description: ExcludeProperties defines dpfilter.PropertyFilters to prevent inclusion of properties to include with dimension updates to the SignalFx backend.

fields.name: NonAlphanumericDimensionChars
fields.description: NonAlphanumericDimensionChars is a list of allowable characters, in addition to alphanumeric ones, to be used in a dimension key.

fields.name: DropHistogramBuckets
fields.description: Whether to drop histogram bucket metrics dispatched to Splunk Observability. Default value is set to false.

fields.name: SendOTLPHistograms
fields.description: Whether to send histogram metrics in OTLP format to Splunk Observability. Default value is set to false.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: Path represents the path the health check service will serve. The default path is "/".

fields.name: Healthy
fields.description: Healthy represents the body of the response returned when the collector is healthy. The default value is ""

fields.name: Unhealthy
fields.description: Unhealthy represents the body of the response returned when the collector is unhealthy. The default value is ""

fields.name: Enabled
fields.description: Enabled indicates whether to not enable collector pipeline check.

fields.name: Interval
fields.description: Interval the time range to check healthy status of collector pipeline

fields.name: ExporterFailureThreshold
fields.description: ExporterFailureThreshold is the threshold of exporter failure numbers during the Interval

fields.name: Attribute
fields.description: The attribute (header name) to look for auth data. Optional, default value: "authorization".

fields.name: IssuerURL
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. IssuerURL is the base URL for the OIDC provider. Required.

fields.name: Audience
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. Audience of the token, used during the verification. For example: "https://accounts.google.com" or "https://login.salesforce.com". Required unless IgnoreAudience is true.

fields.name: IgnoreAudience
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. When true, this skips validating the audience field. Optional.

fields.name: IssuerCAPath
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. The local path for the issuer CA's TLS server cert. Optional.

fields.name: UsernameClaim
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. The claim to use as the username, in case the token's 'sub' isn't the suitable source. Optional.

fields.name: GroupsClaim
fields.description: Deprecated: use Providers instead. The claim that holds the subject's group membership information. Optional.

fields.name: Providers
fields.description: Providers allows configuring multiple OIDC providers. Use the getProviderConfigs() method to get the full list of providers, including the legacy configuration.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. For TCP and UDP networks, the address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Transport
fields.description: Transport to use. Allowed protocols are "tcp", "tcp4" (IPv4-only), "tcp6" (IPv6-only), "udp", "udp4" (IPv4-only), "udp6" (IPv6-only), "ip", "ip4" (IPv4-only), "ip6" (IPv6-only), "unix", "unixgram" and "unixpacket".

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: CAFile
fields.description: Path to the CA cert. For a client this verifies the server certificate. For a server this verifies client certificates. If empty uses system root CA. (optional)

fields.name: CAPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded cert. (optional)

fields.name: IncludeSystemCACertsPool
fields.description: If true, load system CA certificates pool in addition to the certificates configured in this struct.

fields.name: CertFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: CertPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: KeyPem
fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS key to use for TLS required connections. (optional)

fields.name: MinVersion
fields.description: MinVersion sets the minimum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, TLS 1.2 will be used. (optional)

fields.name: MaxVersion
fields.description: MaxVersion sets the maximum TLS version that is acceptable. If not set, refer to crypto/tls for defaults. (optional)

fields.name: CipherSuites
fields.description: CipherSuites is a list of TLS cipher suites that the TLS transport can use. If left blank, a safe default list is used. See https://go.dev/src/crypto/tls/cipher_suites.go for a list of supported cipher suites.

fields.name: ReloadInterval
fields.description: ReloadInterval specifies the duration after which the certificate will be reloaded If not set, it will never be reloaded (optional)

fields.name: CurvePreferences
fields.description: contains the elliptic curves that will be used in an ECDHE handshake, in preference order Defaults to empty list and "crypto/tls" defaults are used, internally.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: The path to the TPM device or Unix domain socket. For instance /dev/tpm0 or /dev/tpmrm0.

fields.name: ClientCAFile
fields.description: Path to the TLS cert to use by the server to verify a client certificate. (optional) This sets the ClientCAs and ClientAuth to RequireAndVerifyClientCert in the TLSConfig. Please refer to https://godoc.org/crypto/tls#Config for more information. (optional)

fields.name: ReloadClientCAFile
fields.description: Reload the ClientCAs file when it is modified (optional, default false)

fields.name: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB
fields.description: MaxRecvMsgSizeMiB sets the maximum size (in MiB) of messages accepted by the server.

fields.name: MaxConcurrentStreams
fields.description: MaxConcurrentStreams sets the limit on the number of concurrent streams to each ServerTransport. It has effect only for streaming RPCs.

fields.name: ReadBufferSize
fields.description: ReadBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.ReadBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#ReadBufferSize).

fields.name: WriteBufferSize
fields.description: WriteBufferSize for gRPC server. See grpc.WriteBufferSize. (https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WriteBufferSize).

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: Include propagates the incoming connection's metadata to downstream consumers.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares for the gRPC server.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The target to which the exporter is going to send traces or metrics, using the gRPC protocol. The valid syntax is described at https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md.

fields.name: Compression
fields.description: The compression key for supported compression types within collector.

fields.name: WaitForReady
fields.description: WaitForReady parameter configures client to wait for ready state before sending data. (https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/wait-for-ready.md)

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The headers associated with gRPC requests.

fields.name: BalancerName
fields.description: Sets the balancer in grpclb_policy to discover the servers. Default is pick_first. https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/blob/master/examples/features/load_balancing/README.md

fields.name: Authority
fields.description: WithAuthority parameter configures client to rewrite ":authority" header (godoc.org/google.golang.org/grpc#WithAuthority)

fields.name: InstanceUID
fields.description: InstanceUID is a UUID formatted as a 36 character string in canonical representation. Auto-generated on start if missing.

fields.name: ReportsEffectiveConfig
fields.description: ReportsEffectiveConfig enables the OpAMP ReportsEffectiveConfig Capability. (default: true)

fields.name: ReportsHealth
fields.description: ReportsHealth enables the OpAMP ReportsHealth Capability. (default: true)

fields.name: ReportsAvailableComponents
fields.description: ReportsAvailableComponents enables the OpAMP ReportsAvailableComponents Capability (default: true)

fields.name: NonIdentifyingAttributes
fields.description: NonIdentifyingAttributes are a map of key-value pairs that may be specified to provide extra information about the agent to the OpAMP server.

fields.name: IncludeResourceAttributes
fields.description: IncludeResourceAttributes determines whether the agent should copy its resource attributes to the non identifying attributes. (default: false)

fields.name: PPID
fields.description: PPID is the process ID of the parent for the collector. If the PPID is specified, the extension will continuously poll for the status of the parent process, and emit a fatal error when the parent process is no longer running. If unspecified, the orphan detection logic does not run.

fields.name: PPIDPollInterval
fields.description: PPIDPollInterval is the time between polling for whether PPID is running.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the listening address for the server.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.description: AllowedOrigins sets the allowed values of the Origin header for HTTP/JSON requests to an OTLP receiver. An origin may contain a wildcard (*) to replace 0 or more characters (e.g., "http://*.domain.com", or "*" to allow any origin).

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.description: AllowedHeaders sets what headers will be allowed in CORS requests. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Type, and Content-Language headers are implicitly allowed. If no headers are listed, X-Requested-With will also be accepted by default. Include "*" to allow any request header.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.description: MaxAge sets the value of the Access-Control-Max-Age response header. Set it to the number of seconds that browsers should cache a CORS preflight response for.

fields.name: RequestParameters
fields.description: RequestParameters is a list of parameters that should be extracted from the request and added to the context. When a parameter is found in both the query string and the header, the value from the query string will be used.

fields.name: MaxRequestBodySize
fields.description: MaxRequestBodySize sets the maximum request body size in bytes. Default: 20MiB.

fields.name: IncludeMetadata
fields.description: IncludeMetadata propagates the client metadata from the incoming requests to the downstream consumers

fields.name: ResponseHeaders
fields.description: Additional headers attached to each HTTP response sent to the client. Header values are opaque since they may be sensitive.

fields.name: CompressionAlgorithms
fields.description: CompressionAlgorithms configures the list of compression algorithms the server can accept. Default: ["", "gzip", "zstd", "zlib", "snappy", "deflate"]

fields.name: ReadTimeout
fields.description: ReadTimeout is the maximum duration for reading the entire request, including the body. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout. Because ReadTimeout does not let Handlers make per-request decisions on each request body's acceptable deadline or upload rate, most users will prefer to use ReadHeaderTimeout. It is valid to use them both.

fields.name: ReadHeaderTimeout
fields.description: ReadHeaderTimeout is the amount of time allowed to read request headers. The connection's read deadline is reset after reading the headers and the Handler can decide what is considered too slow for the body. If ReadHeaderTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: WriteTimeout
fields.description: WriteTimeout is the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response. It is reset whenever a new request's header is read. Like ReadTimeout, it does not let Handlers make decisions on a per-request basis. A zero or negative value means there will be no timeout.

fields.name: IdleTimeout
fields.description: IdleTimeout is the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled. If IdleTimeout is zero, the value of ReadTimeout is used. If both are zero, there is no timeout.

fields.name: Middlewares
fields.description: Middlewares are used to add custom functionality to the HTTP server. Middleware handlers are called in the order they appear in this list, with the first middleware becoming the outermost handler.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: Endpoint configures the address for this network connection. The address has the form "host:port". The host must be a literal IP address, or a host name that can be resolved to IP addresses. The port must be a literal port number or a service name. If the host is a literal IPv6 address it must be enclosed in square brackets, as in "[2001:db8::1]:80" or "[fe80::1%zone]:80". The zone specifies the scope of the literal IPv6 address as defined in RFC 4007.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time a dial will wait for a connect to complete. The default is no timeout.

fields.name: BlockProfileFraction
fields.description: Fraction of blocking events that are profiled. A value <= 0 disables profiling. See https://golang.org/pkg/runtime/#SetBlockProfileRate for details.

fields.name: MutexProfileFraction
fields.description: Fraction of mutex contention events that are profiled. A value <= 0 disables profiling. See https://golang.org/pkg/runtime/#SetMutexProfileFraction for details.

fields.name: SaveToFile
fields.description: Optional file name to save the CPU profile to. The profiling starts when the Collector starts and is saved to the file when the Collector is terminated.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: How to authenticate to the K8s API server.  This can be one of `none` (for no auth), `serviceAccount` (to use the standard service account token provided to the agent pod), or `kubeConfig` to use credentials from `~/.kube/config`.

fields.name: Context
fields.description: When using auth_type `kubeConfig`, override the current context.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.description: ClientID is the application's ID. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.2

fields.name: ClientIDFile
fields.description: ClientIDFile is the file path to read the application's ID from.

fields.name: ClientSecret
fields.description: ClientSecret is the application's secret. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1

fields.name: ClientSecretFile
fields.description: ClientSecretFile is the file pathg to read the application's secret from.

fields.name: EndpointParams
fields.description: EndpointParams specifies additional parameters for requests to the token endpoint.

fields.name: TokenURL
fields.description: TokenURL is the resource server's token endpoint URL. This is a constant specific to each server. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.2

fields.name: Scopes
fields.description: Scope specifies optional requested permissions. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.3

fields.description: In memory PEM encoded TLS cert to use for TLS required connections. (optional)
